title: Fatunad
author: Fatunad
content: Dota2 players/fan out there.What can you say about the current Prize pool of The international 12?Why its too damn low compared into previous years on which it supposed to be that much bigger?Whats Gaben plan behind in all of this?TI12 would be starting on;Group Stage - October 12 - October 15, 2023Main Event - October 20 - October 22 (Playoffs Weekend) & October 27 - October 29 (Finals Weekend), 2023LinkCurrent prize pool.Base Prize Pool   $1,600,000Contributed Prize Pool$1,309,865Total Prize Pool$2,909,865These numbers are really that low. If they had just released those Skins,Immortals,Arcanas instead of Compedium.Then we might be seeing huge numbers on here. So sad to see this current year of The international.

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: Quote from: Fatunad on October 09, 2023, 07:40:51 PMDota2 players/fan out there.What can you say about the current Prize pool of The international 12?Why its too damn low compared into previous years on which it supposed to be that much bigger?Whats Gaben plan behind in all of this?Too low compared to the past The Internationals that we've seen but there's nothing players and participants can do right now with that as Valve is the one that's setting the prize based on the release that they do. Compendium didn't sold a lot and that's 25% sales will be taken and allocation to the TI12's prize pool and that only means that only a few people supported it compared to the past TIs with battle pass. I think that BP is more sellable than the compendium but the mistake Valve is doing is that they're going to release it after TI. I haven't followed the other esports but maybe there's something to do with the bump and relay to the counter strike 2. Although we all love both of these esports and we're playing all of it but maybe they just did a wrong decision this time and the community didn't like the response Gaben and Valve did. Who knows maybe if they'll have some surprise on the actual TI day? I'm just waiting for the release of the group stages as maybe tomorrow, list will be there.Quote from: Fatunad on October 09, 2023, 07:40:51 PMTI12 would be starting on;Group Stage - October 12 - October 15, 2023Main Event - October 20 - October 22 (Playoffs Weekend) & October 27 - October 29 (Finals Weekend), 2023LinkCurrent prize pool.Base Prize Pool   $1,600,000Contributed Prize Pool$1,309,865Total Prize Pool$2,909,865These numbers are really that low. That's for sure and teams are still going to push harder on this one as it's like an achievement that everyone is knocking to get despite the prize pool is low this time.
